content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 5 column table with 1 row of data. The heading for column 1 is “x.” The heading for column 2 is “f of x.” The heading for column 3 is “f prime of x.” The heading for column 4 is “g of x.” The heading for column 5 is “g prime of x.” The data are as follows. Row 1. x is 2. f of x is negative 3. f prime of x is one half. g of x is negative 3. g prime of x is 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="false" frame="solid" framespacing="0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05em" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="2.25ex" height="3.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above gives values of the differentiable functions <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and their derivatives at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="h of x equals, the fraction with numerator 4 times f of x, and denominator g of x, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="h prime of 2, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
